headline.main: Godley's Fine Start Continues, D'backs Beat Nats 6-4
headline.print_headline: Godley's Fine Start Continues, D'backs Beat Nats 6-4

docs.snippet: Rookie Zack Godley pitched six scoreless innings to continue a stellar start to his career, and the Arizona Diamondbacks homered four times in a 6-4 victory over the Washington Nationals on Monday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rookie Zack Godley pitched six scoreless innings to continue a stellar start to his career, and the Arizona Diamondbacks homered four times in a 6-4 victory over the Washington Nationals on Monday night.

headline.main: Obama Administration Faces Criticism Over Human Trafficking Report
headline.print_headline: Obama Administration Faces Criticism Over Human Trafficking Report

docs.snippet: Several U.S. politicians sharply criticized the Obama administration on Monday over an annual global report on human trafficking in response to a Reuters article chronicling how senior U.S. diplomats had watered down rankings of more than a dozen ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Several U.S. politicians sharply criticized the Obama administration on Monday over an annual global report on human trafficking in response to a Reuters article chronicling how senior U.S. diplomats had watered down rankings of more than a dozen strategically important countries.

headline.main: Libyan Accused in Benghazi Attacks Seeks Dismissal of Case
headline.print_headline: Libyan Accused in Benghazi Attacks Seeks Dismissal of Case

docs.snippet: A Libyan militant accused in the 2012 Benghazi attacks has asked a judge to dismiss charges against him....

headline.main: Hackers Exploit ‘Flash’ Vulnerability in Yahoo Ads

docs.snippet: The attack took advantage of Adobe Flash software that needed updating to direct traffic to other sites or even hold a computer for ransom....
docs.abstract: The attack took advantage of Adobe Flash software that needed updating to direct traffic to other sites or even hold a computer for ransom.

headline.main: No. 6 Seed Petkovic Advances at Bank of the West
headline.print_headline: No. 6 Seed Petkovic Advances at Bank of the West

docs.snippet: Sixth-seeded Andrea Petkovic got her body realigned and returned to form to beat fellow German Carina Witthoeft in a first-round match of the Bank of the West Classic on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sixth-seeded Andrea Petkovic got her body realigned and returned to form to beat fellow German Carina Witthoeft in a first-round match of the Bank of the West Classic on Monday.

headline.main: VA to Review Status of Marines Affected by Tainted Water
headline.print_headline: VA to Review Status of Marines Affected by Tainted Water

docs.snippet: The Department of Veterans Affairs announced Monday it will begin reviewing the disability status of Marines who developed cancers and other conditions due to exposure to chemicals that contaminated the water at Camp Lejeune (luh-ZHERN') for more ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Department of Veterans Affairs announced Monday it will begin reviewing the disability status of Marines who developed cancers and other conditions due to exposure to chemicals that contaminated the water at Camp Lejeune (luh-ZHERN') for more than 30 years.

headline.main: Two People Killed When Circus Tent Collapses in New Hampshire During Storm
headline.print_headline: Two People Killed When Circus Tent Collapses in New Hampshire During Storm

docs.snippet: Two people were killed and 15 others injured when a circus tent collapsed in New Hampshire during a storm on Monday night, according to WCVB TV station, an ABC affiliate....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two people were killed and 15 others injured when a circus tent collapsed in New Hampshire during a storm on Monday night, according to WCVB TV station, an ABC affiliate.

headline.main: Kerry Talks Trade in Singapore Before Regional Security Meet
headline.print_headline: Kerry Talks Trade in Singapore Before Regional Security Meet

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry is in Singapore to talk up an Asia trade agreement that has hit snags in final negotiations.

headline.main: Federal Judge Strikes Down Idaho Law Banning Documentation of Animal Abuse
headline.print_headline: Federal Judge Strikes Down Idaho Law Banning Documentation of Animal Abuse

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Monday struck down an Idaho law that banned documentation of animal abuse at livestock operations, ruling that it violated freedom of speech and other constitutionally guaranteed rights....
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Monday struck down an Idaho law that banned documentation of animal abuse at livestock operations, ruling that it violated freedom of speech and other constitutionally guaranteed rights.
